meta.description: Marhaba Lounge at Dubai International Airport (DXB), Terminal 3, Concourse C. Learn more about the lounge: amenities, photos, review, opening hours, location.

location.terminalDirections: East End of Concourse C, between Gates C21 and C23.

general: Children under 2 years old are admitted free with an adult.
warning: Shower facilities are subject to payment and usage is restricted to 30 minutes.
regulatory: This lounge is only accessible for passengers departing from Terminal 3.

reviews.content: It’s fine really. Nothing special, but quite comfortable. The other negative reviews don’t quite fit the lounge. It does get busy and staff suggests you have a look before you buy access at the desk.
Terrible lounge - cramped, noisy, cold food with limited selection and dirty restrooms, not worth the money at all - you are better off going to Costa outside.
This lounge does not accept two Priority Pass cards under same person. If you are with your wife and two kids, even though you have multiple cards, they will not accept.
Staff are unhappy and seem smug.
Staff are friendly. Food is OK but wide enough choice. Having to pay for showers is a little cheeky seeing as you can grab a free one a 5 min walk away.

I paid AED 195 for 4 hours.The staff is very polite and friendly. Food is average with little non-veg options. The chairs are comfy. If lucky, you'll get a seat with a wall charger that actually works.
Very crowded, the food has healthy options though and there are drinks.
Lounge overcrowded, food was okay, toilets too small for the number of passengers and was dirty.
The lounge is small and can easily get crowded. The menu is just at acceptable level. Toilets are small. Shower is available but I did not try. Overall not the best Marhaba lounge in DXB.
Overcrowded, staff seems to be ok, seats are not at all comfortable! Overall disappointed!
Made a transit during the wee hours 1am. Quite a number of people sleeping on the seats. Food is mostly sandwiches and pastries, nothing heavy. Overall a decent lounge to get quick bites and wifi.
Great food selection. Nice variety. Bathrooms a little small and was quite crowded during the waking hours that I was there. 1AM.
Old seats, emergency exit blocked, food is ok (nice variety of Indian food and snacks), separate smoking room included.
I started at the Lufthansa lounge (across the hallway) since I had a nice experience there last year. Staff enthusiasm and food selection doesn't compare to this lounge. I'm glad I stopped in.
This Marhaba Lounge in Terminal 1 is one of the worst I had never visited. Crowded and very little food selection. Not worth the visit.
Overcrowded. There are literally no chairs to sit on right now.
Fairly comfortable and clean, decent food and premium beverages. It can be a little crowded at times.
The front desk lady is so unprofessional, flirting with her colleagues and ignoring customers. The food choice is nice though and the chairs are very comfortable.

The lounge is not crowded. The food is amazing.

Unfortunately, the washroom was not that clean. I have had to go outside the lounge for washroom.
Unfortunately, the price is not worth the experience ($50 for 4 hours).
This lounge was a great experience, consisting of a good selection of food and beverages.
This lounge has a great view of the Tarmac. Also, it has good food and excellent service.
Because this place allows walk-in passengers, it can easily get crowded. Though the food and drink selection is small, it's acceptable.
Good selection of premium food and bar. This lounge now has a shower, but for a 50 AED charge.
They have a good selection of food, including good Indian food, coffee/dates, and good selection of newspapers. It's not usually crowded, and the shower is available for an additional charge.

location.terminalDirections: Arrivals Area.

otherLounges.name: Their Patio by Plaza Premium Group

location.terminalDirections: Located in the arrivals area after exiting baggage claim.
Take the lift located next to the souvenir shop to Level 6. Located prior to Gates A1-A12.
After Security Checkpoint and Passport Control, take the elevators located between Gates A1 and A24 to the Hotel Reception on Level 6.
Level 4, between Gates A1 and A24.
Level 5, between Gates A2 and A3. Entrance is via dedicated elevator from the perfume area of the Duty Free Area.
Located in the West Wing of Concourse A, between Gates A2 and A3. Take the lift from the Duty Free Area to the entrance on Level 4.
Opposite Gate A1 in the Duty Free Area.
5th Floor, between Gates A1 and A24
After Security Checkpoint and Passport Control, take the elevators located near Gates B14 or B22 to the Hotel Reception.
4th Floor, between Gates B16 and B18, near the Information Desk.

otherLounges.name: Lounge @ B (Closed for Renovation, Temp Lounge at Gate B22)

location.terminalDirections: Next to Gate B26, above McDonald's on the 2nd Floor, accessible via escalator, entrance is located inside the Cadiz Tapas Bar.
Level 4, near Gate B21, entrance is right after XpresSpa.

otherLounges.name: Sleep n' Fly Sleep Lounge, Business Pods and Showers

location.terminalDirections: Located between Gates B14 and B18, close to the Emirates Connections Desk.
5th Floor, between Gates B16 and B18.
Located next to Gate C13.
After Security Checkpoint and Passport Control, take the escalators or elevators located between Gates C15 and C17 to the Hotel Reception.

C-Gates, Central Lower Level Duty Free Area. Lounge check-in is via the separate main reception at departure gate level next to Gate C14. The sleep 'n fly lounge is located one level down in the Duty Free Area.
Near Gate C8.
Near Gate C28.
